definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: They tried to rally the pound sterling but in vain.
sentences.chinese: 他们企图恢复英镑币值，但劳而无功。

sentences.english: International transactions are done at nominal, not PPP, currency values.
sentences.chinese: 国际间贸易是以名义币值进行的，而非PPP。

sentences.english: If you can't pay your debts, debase your currency.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能还债，那就把降低币值。

sentences.english: The resumption of specie payment appreciated the currency.
sentences.chinese: 恢复给硬币，使币值更高。

sentences.english: There was also discussion about financial markets and currency values.
sentences.chinese: 会议也讨论了金融市场和货币币值的问题。

sentences.english: Until the Japanese surrender in 1945, counterfeit currency plummeted.
sentences.chinese: 延至1945年日寇投降，伪钞币值一落千丈。

sentences.english: Budget deficits and long-term debt that are spiraling out of control and leading to the steady erosion of the value of money.
sentences.chinese: 预算赤字和长期负债急剧上升稳步侵蚀着币值。
